properties.name: query
properties.description:
Your main way to learn information.

Avoid generic queries and try to be specific.

The following topics are available for investigation:
properties.instructions: Instruct another agent to retrieve information about the scene, world and its characters. When looking to retrieve character specific information for a specific character you must provide the character's name. When multiple characters are involved, it may make sense to query for each AND do a general world query.

properties.name: query
properties.instructions: A semantic query aiming to retrieve information. Must always be formatted as a question. It helps to specify the chronological element of the question, if you are asking something about the past state so. If you're interested about information in the current moment state so.

Use this function to retrieve narration relevant information about the world and the characters in it.

Character attributes, details and backstory.
World information, lore and facts.

examples.query: What is Detective Rivera's current emotional state and how is she handling the stress of this ongoing investigation?
What magical abilities did Marcus possess in the past before he learned to control them, and how did he first discover them?
What is the current political situation in the capital city and are there any ongoing conflicts between different factions happening right now?
What creatures historically inhabited the Darkwood Forest and what were their past hunting patterns before the recent disturbances?

properties.instructions:
Use this function to retrieve the exact value of a specific context source. YOU MUST ONLY USE THIS IF YOU HAVE BEEN EXPLICITY INSTRUCTED TO AND PROVIDED WITH THE ID(s) TO RETRIEVE.

YOU CANNOT USE THIS WITHOUT PASSING AN EXACT CONTEXT ID.

properties.name: character
properties.instructions:
When querying information about a character provide the exact character name here.

The instructions may provide an alias of the name, check the provided list of character names as the system use it to obtain the system internal name.

properties.name: query
properties.instructions: A semantic query aiming to retrieve information. Must always be formatted as a question.

properties.template:
Call the appropriate function(s) to best answer the query.

First analyze the query and decide which function(s) you want to select, then call them.

Your task is NOT to answer the query yourself, your task is only to call the functions necessary to obtain an answer.

IMPORTANT: YOU DO NOT KNOW THE ANSWER. YOU ARE NEVER SEEING ALL OF THE CONTEXT HERE, YOU MUST MAKE AT LEAST ONE FUNCTION CALL.

QUERY: {query}

properties.description_chat:
Learn information about the world, lore.

When asking questions about world context it helps to specify chronological importance. If you want to know something about the past say so, if you're more interested in information about the current moment specify it.
instruction_examples: Find out when Clara and Katherin got married.
Find out when the last emergency broadcast was sent.

properties.description_chat: Retrieve configuration information about the story and scene.
instruction_examples: Tell me what the overall story intention is.
What is the full story description for this experience?

properties.name: query
properties.instructions: A semantic query aiming to retrieve information. Must always be formatted as a question. Should mention specific gamestate keys if known.

Use this function to query for information about the current game state variables. Game state stores mechanical game-related variables such as numeric values (health points, inventory counts, combat stats, relationship scores, etc.) and game flags/booleans.

IMPORTANT: Game state does NOT contain narrative context, character descriptions, world lore, or story information. For that information, use query_world instead.

In story-driven experiences, the game state may be completely empty if no mechanical variables are being tracked.

examples.query: Are we currently tracking whether or not the user has interacted with the locked door in the cellar?

properties.name: query
properties.instructions: A semantic query aiming to retrieve information about the director's autonomous turns. Must always be formatted as a question.

properties.description_chat:
Investigate the game state variables.

When querying the game state explicitly state that the game state should be queried.
instruction_examples: What is the current game state for Mary's health?

properties.instructions: Use this function to query for information about the director's autonomous turns taken during scene direction.

examples.query: Did I recently direct the narrator to narrate an explosion in the factory?
What did i do recently during my autonomous turns?

properties.description_chat:
Investigate your autonomous turns taken outside of the context of this chat with the user.

These turns happen outside the context of your chat with the user, but the user may refer to them anyways. Essentially when the user asks why you did something or references an action you're not immediately aware of, query here - it may have happened during your autonomous turn.
instruction_examples: Did I recently direct the narrator to narrate an explosion in the factory?
What did i do recently during my autonomous turns?

example_json.name: example_json
example_json.description: An example JSON payload for the action
